page.title: 03BISHOPSBOURNE VILLAGE (1)
page.content: Bishopsbourne is a small village in the Nailbourne Valley. It is bounded by Bourne Park on the north and Char- lton Park on the south, both beauti- fully landscaped areas. It is mention- ed in the Domesday Book as "Burnes", i.e. situated on the Bourne. The Nail- bourne River flows underground, ris- ing above ground intermittently and unpredictably, an event which, accord- ing to legend, is an omen of national disaster. The life in the village is still influenced by the Bourne Estate, which has been sold only three times since the Norman Conquest. The village has an "old world" charm. The dwell- ings combine cottages of character with terraced houses built for estate workers and a high proportion of these still belong to the Bourne Estate and are rented. Near the church are a number of larger properties.
